trans-unit.source: Azure portal for MAM policies | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Azure portal for MAM policies | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Create mobile app management policies using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Create mobile app management policies using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The policies you create here can be applied to devices with or without enrollment in Intune.
trans-unit.target: The policies you create here can be applied to devices with or without enrollment in Intune.

trans-unit.source: Azure portal for Microsoft Intune MAM policies
trans-unit.target: Azure portal for Microsoft Intune MAM policies

trans-unit.source: Accessing the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Accessing the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: The **Azure portal** allows you create and manage mobile app management policies.
trans-unit.target: The **Azure portal** allows you create and manage mobile app management policies.

trans-unit.source: Azure portal supports creating MAM policies for:
trans-unit.target: Azure portal supports creating MAM policies for:

trans-unit.source: Apps running on devices **enrolled and managed by Intune**.
trans-unit.target: Apps running on devices **enrolled and managed by Intune**.

trans-unit.source: Apps running on devices that are **not enrolled** in any MDM solution.
trans-unit.target: Apps running on devices that are **not enrolled** in any MDM solution.

trans-unit.source: Apps running on devices that are **enrolled in a third party MDM solution**.
trans-unit.target: Apps running on devices that are **enrolled in a third party MDM solution**.

trans-unit.source: If you are currently using the Intune admin console to manage your devices, you can create a MAM policy that supports apps for devices enrolled in Intune using the [Intune admin console](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md).
trans-unit.target: If you are currently using the Intune admin console to manage your devices, you can create a MAM policy that supports apps for devices enrolled in Intune using the [Intune admin console](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md).

trans-unit.source: You may not see all MAM policy settings in the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: You may not see all MAM policy settings in the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal is the new admin console for creating MAM policies.If you create MAM policies on both Intune admin console and Azure portal, the policy in the Azure portal is applied to the apps and deployed to users.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal is the new admin console for creating MAM policies.If you create MAM policies on both Intune admin console and Azure portal, the policy in the Azure portal is applied to the apps and deployed to users.

trans-unit.source: Login to the Azure portal and customize your start page
trans-unit.target: Login to the Azure portal and customize your start page

trans-unit.source: Go the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com) and sign in with your [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] credentials.
trans-unit.target: Go the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com) and sign in with your [!INCLUDE[wit_nextref](../includes/wit_nextref_md.md)] credentials.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Azure portal log in page
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Azure portal log in page

trans-unit.source: Once you are successfully signed in, you will see the **Dashboard**.
trans-unit.target: Once you are successfully signed in, you will see the **Dashboard**.

trans-unit.source: The **Dashboard** page can be customized.
trans-unit.target: The **Dashboard** page can be customized.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Azure portal dashboard
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Azure portal dashboard

trans-unit.source: From the **Browse** menu, find **Intune**.![Screenshot of the Browse menu with Intune highlighted
trans-unit.target: From the **Browse** menu, find **Intune**.![Screenshot of the Browse menu with Intune highlighted

trans-unit.source: Choose **Intune > Intune mobile application management > Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Intune > Intune mobile application management > Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Intune mobile application management blade
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Intune mobile application management blade

trans-unit.source: To pin a blade to the **Start** page, you can use the **pin** option on the blade.
trans-unit.target: To pin a blade to the **Start** page, you can use the **pin** option on the blade.

trans-unit.source: Click the pin icon on the **Intune mobile application management blade**, to pin it to the **Start** page.
trans-unit.target: Click the pin icon on the **Intune mobile application management blade**, to pin it to the **Start** page.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the Intune mobile application management blade with the pin icon highlighted
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the Intune mobile application management blade with the pin icon highlighted

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the dashboard with the pinned Intune tile
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the dashboard with the pinned Intune tile

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Get ready to configure mobile app management policies
trans-unit.target: Get ready to configure mobile app management policies
